column4: Amazon's Bezos to buy the Washington Post for $250 million
column5: Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos will buy the Washington Post newspaper for $250 million in a surprise deal that ends the Graham family's 80 years of ownership and hands one of the country's most influential publications to the businessman whose Internet company has transformed retailing. | Video

column4: Column: Jeff Bezos is an owner who knows how to deliver
column5: As the American newspaper business began its red-ink slide in the late 2000s  I fully expected a billionaire to rescue the financially struggling Washington Post. But I never thought its savior would be Amazon founder Jeff Bezos  who purchased the paper today for $250 million.

column4: RPT-NEWSMAKER-Jeff Bezos  tech pioneer to turn media baron
column5: SEATTLE  Aug 5 Jeff Bezos  founder of Amazon.com Inc and soon to be the new owner of the Washington Post  is one of the few chief executives in corporate America who refuse to bow to Wall Street's quarterly profit demands.
